did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Willis A. Tingey papers, 1960-1994
did.abstract: Contains mainly documents created by Willis A. Tingey related to land management, area development and irrigation on the Navajo and Hopi Indian reservations, Arizona and New Mexico, 1960-1994.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Willis A. Tingey papers(AZ 558). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains mainly documents created by Willis A. Tingey related to land management, area development and irrigation on the Navajo and Hopi Indian reservations, Arizona and New Mexico, 1960-1994.

did.unittitle: Correspondence. May-July, 1986

scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Tingey and Gary Rydout, Librarian at the Western Archeological and Conservation Center, related to the acquisition of the collection and containing Tingey's extensive comments on the origin and significance of the documents.

did.unittitle: Monograph, An Approach to Engineering Problems: a Preliminary Title Listing on Reconnaissance Model Study Plans for a Manuscript Series on Full Area Development. 1960

1975
Monograph, Navajo-Hopi Indian Reservations: an Atlas of Maps. copy 3. 1977

Monograph, Area (Land) Inventory Study: U.S. Public Lands Surveys and Resurveys, Section 36 and Vicinity, T12N R1E Salt Lake Meridian. 1983

Monograph, A Reconnaissance Study Layout Plan: Commercial Drip and Gravity Flow Low Pressure Irrigation Systems, Many Farms Cooperative Farm Project, Many Farms, Arizona, and a Garden Irrigation Development Unit, Logan, Utah. copy 5. 1983
Monograph, The Use of Standard Topographical Maps and Photography in the Development of Route Surveys and Area Study Plans. 1983

1986

Monograph, A Reconnaissance Study Plan on Full Development of a Resource Area: South Paria, Utah to Junct. Upper Paria Valley with Cottonwood Creek and Vicinity (an example). 1986
Monograph, Navajo Farming, by Sam and Janet Bingham. Logan, Utah: Utah State University, 1979. Inscribed by authors. 1979

Map Index to published standard topographical maps in or adjacent to the eastern Navajo Division Navajo Indian reservation, New Mexico; Arizona Division, Navajo/Hopi Indian reservations; Utah Division, Navajo Indian reservation. No Date

An atlas of modern standard topographical maps. Total area coverage at the map scale 1/24,000 or 1/62,500 and total area coverage at map scale of 1/100,00. The exhibit has not been assembled as part of the report. No Date
A geographical dictionary on cities, towns, vil-lages, etc. in or adjacent to Navajo/Hopi Indian reservations in Arizona, New Mexico, and Utah. No Date
A gazetteer on cities, towns, villages, etc., in or adjacent to east section, eastern Navajo division, Navajo Indian reservations and vicinity, New Mexico. No Date
Appendages to geographical dictionary on cities, towns, villages, etc. in or adjacent to Navajo/Hopi Indian reservations, 1952-62. 1986
An atlas of maps prepared by the Bureau of Indian Affairs on small (misc.) irrigation projects lo-cated in the Navajo/Hopi Indian reservations, Arizona and New Mexico, 1956. 1987

Navajo Project, Hogback Unit, New Mexico. Comple-tion report, December 1962 by Vernon J. Larson. Assembled as an appendage to a geographical dic-tionary on cities, towns, villages, etc., in or adjacent to Navajo/Hopi Indian reservations in Arizona, New Mexico, Utah, Colorado. 1986-1987
